answerText: retrosynthesis [or word forms; or retrosynthetic analysis][10] This phenomenon is the inversion of the polarity of a carbon atom. Dieter Seebach coined this German term, and with Corey, names a method of changing the polarity of a carbonyl carbon using dithianes.
heading: ACF Regionals |2014 | Dartmouth and Notre Dame | 10 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] It's often easiest to plan syntheses by working backward from the starting material, cleaving carbon-carbon bonds to generate common synthetic equivalents. Such an approach, pioneered by EJ Corey,  is given this name.
